summary: eight IIDs are listed as notifiable infectious diseases, including cholera, poliomyelitis, dysentery, typhoid and paratyphoid (TAP), viral Hepatitis A, viral Hepatitis E, hand-foot-mouth disease (HFMD) and other infectious diarrhoeal diseases (OIDDs) the aim of the study is to analyse the spatio-temporal distribution of IIDs from 2006 to 2016. HFMD and OIDD exhibited high incidence rates. the incidence rate of Hepatitis E gradually surpassed Hepatitis A. authorities should pay more attention to Class C diseases and Hepatitis E.
